official-title.#text:
Providing for authority to initiate litigation for actions by the President or other executive
			 branch officials inconsistent with their duties under the Constitution of
			 the United States.

sponsor.#tail: submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such
			 provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

is authorized to initiate or intervene in one or more civil actions on behalf of
			 the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
in a Federal court of competent jurisdiction
			 to seek any appropriate relief regarding the failure of the

, the
			 head of any department or agency, or any other officer or employee of the
			 executive branch, to act in a manner consistent with that official’s
			 duties under the Constitution and laws of the United States with respect
			 to implementation of any provision of the

Patient Protection and
			 Affordable Care Act
